articles.title: VCs abandon old rules for a ‘funky time’ of investing in AI startups

articles.title: Apple’s new App Review Guidelines clamp down on apps sharing personal data with ‘third-party AI’
articles.summary: Apple updates its App Store rules to restrict apps from sharing personal data with third-party AI without disclosure and explicit permission.

articles.title: OpenAI’s new LLM exposes the secrets of how AI really works
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has built an experimental large language model that is far easier to understand than typical models.  That’s a big deal, because today’s LLMs are black boxes: Nobody fully underst.
articles.content: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has built an experimental large language model that is far easier to understand than typical models. That’s a big deal, because today’s LLMs are black boxes: Nobody fully understands how they do what they do. Building a model that is more transparent sheds light on how LLMs work
articles.author: Will Douglas Heaven

articles.title: Google’s SIMA 2 agent uses Gemini to reason and act in virtual worlds
articles.summary: “SIMA 2 is a more general agent.  It can complete complex tasks in previously unseen environments.
articles.content: “SIMA 2 is a more general agent. It can complete complex tasks in previously unseen environments. And it's a self-improving agent... which is a step toward more genera- purpose robots and AGI systems more generally.”
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Microsoft’s plan to fix its chip problem is, partly, to let OpenAI do the heavy lifting
articles.summary: The tech giant plans to leverage its partner's custom chip development to bolster its own struggling semiconductor efforts, a move that looks increasingly pragmatic given Microsoft's lackluster perfor.
articles.content: The tech giant plans to leverage its partner's custom chip development to bolster its own struggling semiconductor efforts, a move that looks increasingly pragmatic given Microsoft's lackluster performance compared to rivals like Google and Amazon.

articles.content: Marc Manara, OpenAI’s head of startups, says the reality of AI has advanced far beyond ideas and experiments. AI-native companies are hitting $200 million in annual recurring revenue, and product cycles have shrunk from two-week sprints to single days. And OpenAI is helping. Today on TechCrunc
